page.title: 01Dornoch Links and Beach
page.content: This is a coastal block, three quarters of which to the East is sea. Landward, the remaining quarter, from North to South, extends from below Embo Street, to a point below the Dornoch Landing Strip. A sandy beach, stretching the full length of the block, is used by bathers and for angling from the shore. An inshore rescue boat run by volunteers is stored there. Land North West, within the block, is covered by Royal Dornoch Eighteen Hole Championship Golf Course, in process of being extended, covers land in the centre West of the block, alongside of Dorncoh Holiday Caravan Site, part of Dornoch known as Bishopfield and part of Dornoch known as Littletown. A helicopter landing place is situated near the Golf Clubhouse.
